instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  No Green light . <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> stuck in 3.3v.
threads.message:
Hi all,
THis is a liquid dmg board only near <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> ,<TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7036</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C7035</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C7037</CAPACITOR>.  I replaced all these and still get 3.77v on <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> current sensing resistors. 

Resistance between <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> & 21 is 21ohms and <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> is 2.9ohms.

I replaced U 7000 still the same.

<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> all pins have 16.5v.  <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> pin 1-4 I get 16.5v then the rest 3.7v

<RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>CHGR_AGATE</SIGNAL> both side 16.5v.

Well when the battery connected, I get  16V <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/ <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> and  10v on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and fan goes high.

this is what I get with our battery connected on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

PIN 1 = 14.5V                PIN 8 = 3.3V
PIN 2 = 13.9V                PIN 9 = 3.7V
PIN 3 = 3.9V                 PIN 10 TO 18 = 3.3V
PIN 4 =3.3V                  PIN 19  = 8.9V
PIN 5 = 3.3V                PIN 20  =7.8V
PIN 6=  3.3V               PIN 21  =0V PIN 22 0V
PIN 7 = 3.3V              PIN 23/24 = 3.3V , PIN 25 8.4V  PIN 26 =15.V , PIN 27/28 3.7V

Appriciate your help.

Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  No Green light . <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> stuck in 3.3v.
threads.message: Just add this. There is no short in <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. How ever ISL chip getting hot with our the battery. When the battery connected no boiling on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  No Green light . <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> stuck in 3.3v.
threads.message:
Pins 19 & 20 should have 5V, generated by <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.
You have higher voltage there.
Change  <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> again and check all solders.
Also change <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> and check if <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> is OK.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  No Green light . <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> stuck in 3.3v.
threads.message: Hi, THank you for your help. I get pin 19 20 5v when the battery connected. Replaced ISL 2 times.And also replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  No Green light . <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> stuck in 3.3v.
threads.message:
You must get 5V on charger too.
Pin 2 voltage makes me worry; is too low.
Post voltage on both pins of <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>; be sure it has correct value, 20 ohms.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  No Green light . <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> stuck in 3.3v.
threads.message: yes. but I dont get 5v on charger. <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> was 40 ohms and pin 2 was 16v and pin 1 was 13v. I replaced the <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7005</CAPACITOR> now I get 15v on pin2 but still 3.7v on both side  current snce resistors

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  No Green light . <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> stuck in 3.3v.
threads.message: Hi THis is solved. I found <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> again given me 13v. I replaced the ISL and <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> both to gather. problem solved. Thank you so much for giving me advice where to check.  You are a legend.
